titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stanford Family Scrapbooks SC0033F
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig & Jenny Johnson

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-08-24 08:53:27 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.abstract: Family scrapbooks, compiled for the Stanford family. Subjects cover a wide range of family activities including railroad affairs, the Palo Alto Stock Farm, the Vina Ranch, the University, the United States Senate, politics, personal affairs of the Stanford's, and horses.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Stanford family and heirs.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Stanford Family Scrapbooks (SC0033F). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

altformavail.head: Alternative Formats
altformavail.p: Also available on microfilm in Stanford University Archives: Stanford, Calif. : Stanford University Libraries, 197-? 4 microfilm reels; 4 in ., 35 mm.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Leland Stanford was born March 9, 1824 in Watervliet Township, New York. He married Jane Lathrop in 1850 and on May 14, 1868, Jane and Leland's only child was born in Sacramento, California. Leland, Jr. died March 13, 1884 at the age of 15 years, 10 months. His early death inspired the founding of Leland Stanford, Jr. University by his parents. Leland, Sr. died June 21, 1893 and Jane died February 28, 1905.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Family scrapbooks, compiled for the Stanford family. Subjects cover a wide range of family activities including railroad affairs, the Palo Alto Stock Farm, the Vina Ranch, the University, the United States Senate, politics, personal affairs of the Stanford's, and horses.

did.unittitle: Railroad affairs, the Stock Farm, Stanford for President, opening of the university, trip to California, and political activity.
Railroad affairs, the Stock Farm, Stanford for President, opening of the university, trip to California, and political activity.
Leland Stanford, his horses, the Vina Ranch, U. S. Senate, the university, and Stanford's views on a variety of subjects.
Railroad, the university, and the personal affairs of the Stanfords.
Death of Leland Dewitt Stanford (Leland Stanford Jr.).
University, with some clippings on the Vina Ranch (p. 92, 209)
Leland Stanford's politics, horses, death, and will.
Leland Stanford's politics and his horses.
Railroad, Stanford's politics (pp. 19-26), biographical material (pp. 27-46), and nomination to the Senate.
Construction of the university (pp. 1-33), politics, the railroad, and the death of Leland Stanford.
Railroad, Leland Stanford's politics, and horses.
Politics, with some clippings on the university included
New York branch of the Stanford family, especially Welton Stanford and Grant L. Stanford.
Colored picture postcards collected by Jane Stanford on one of her European tours (not microfilmed).
Construction of the Central Pacific Railroad.
Politics (pp. 1-7), the railroad (pp. 8-50), miscellany, and horses (pp. 66-79).
Politics, as well as on other miscellaneous subjects.
Death of Leland Stanford, Stanford University, and horses.
Vrooman Scrapbook: founding of Stanford University.
